page.title: 11BUILDINGS
page.content: The area abounds in old farmsteads nestling in the hillsides. Tradition- ally the barn is a continuation of the farmhouse and has a single large arched door, and ventilation slits (reminiscient of castle arrow slits) instead of windows. There is an inter- esting old cruck barn in Millhouse, though this has fallen into disrepair. There are many old houses, especially in Thurlstone which retains some old weavers cottages. Some victorian terraced housing lines the main road, and both Thurlstone and Millhouse Primary Schools were built by Thurlstone School Board in the later half of the 19th century. There are a few larger victorian houses in the villages. West of Millhouse are Hazelhead Hall and Bullhouse Hall and Chapel (see History).
